title: The Abducted Princess
opening: Once upon a time, the region of Macedon was a territory under Dolhrian rule. A century ago, the dragonkin rulers sent many slaves to these wild forests, to excavate ruins and build a country. Many slaves were forced to work to their limits, barely fed, and then slaughtered.

A young man stood up against such tragic conditions. Iote was his name. He and his companions fled to the forests and fought, astride wyverns, to free the slaves. After Dolhr's demise, the slaves established their own country in these now abundant lands. And the hero Iote was chosen as their first king. And so was born the Kingdom of Macedon, later feared as the domain of dracoknights.
However, the might Macedon was stripped of Prince Michalis, said to be the second coming of Iote, and is now on the brink of losing Princess Minerva, the so-called "Red Dragon."

intro.speaker: Jagen
intro.line: I see you train without the need for sleep. Most admirable, Kris.

intro.speaker: Jagen
intro.line: A strong offense and a tough defense are obviously important, but... You cannot afford to neglect your skill. Without the skill to deliver it, it matters not how mighty your attack is if it does not reach the enemy. Speaking of which...

intro.speaker: Jagen
intro.line: Your skill is like that of an expert... I have nothing to add. Keep up the good work.

intro.speaker: Jagen
intro.line: Your skill is not bad. Don't fall behind the other knights. The experience you gain from training and combat, will help elevate your skill further. Be ever diligent.

intro.speaker: Jagen
intro.line: Your skill is still insufficient... It ought to be better than this. You may or may not have the talent for it, but don't give up... The more experience you gain from training and combat, the more you can refine your skill. Be ever diligent.

intro.speaker: Palla
intro.line: Julian, good news! Catria finally brought the Altean army for us! We're going to join their ranks to help save Princess Minerva. Please take Lena and escape to safety, quickly!

intro.speaker: Julian
intro.line: No can do, Palla. Lena's disappeared... I'm not leaving by myself.

intro.speaker: Palla
intro.line: What? Lena as well... Princess Maria is missing too; why is it only clerics...?

intro.speaker: Julian
intro.line: Anyway, I'm staying in the village to see if I can't find any information. Sorry, Palla. Give my best to Prince Marth.

visit.speaker: Villager
visit.line: This is just between you and me, but I heard that armory is in league with the rebels. If you're going to enter you should be careful not to get jumped.

visit.speaker: Villager
visit.line: I wonder what's going to happen to Macedon? They say that Prince Michalis is dead, and Princess Maria is nowhere to be found... On top of that, they say that Princess Minerva has been captured and that her life is in peril. I just hope... that this country doesn't end up like Grust...

visit.speaker: Villager
visit.line: You know, a little while ago, a paladin came here; said he was on a journey. He was wearing a mask, but I'm sure that underneath, he was a good person. He was kind, yet wrapped in a veil of sorrow. I wonder if I'll ever see him again...

visit.speaker: Villager
visit.line: The pegasus knight trio must be lonely without Est. And I was such a fan of their "Triangle Attack!" too... Oh, Est... Come home already, will ya?

visit.speaker: Villager
visit.line: Have you noticed the large drawbridge behind this village? Normally it's separated by the river, but if you use this key here, you can cross the bridge. Just, once you cross the drawbridge, the enemies on the other side will come and attack you at once. If you want to advance safely, you might be better off taking the long detour that goes right around the mountain. Here, take the key. No matter which path you take, do take care of yourself, m'kay?

recruit-visit.speaker: Marth
recruit-visit.line: You, you're Bord! You've come to Macedon as well?

recruit-visit.speaker: Bord
recruit-visit.line: Long time no see, Prince. Cord already joined with you's guys, right? We Talysian mercenaries wanted to join you's army, so we came all the way here. Princess Caeda's our lady, and the guy who's gonna be her man is important to us too. Prince Marth, I'll protect you with my life.

recruit-visit.speaker: Julian
recruit-visit.line: Hey, Prince, it's been a while, hasn't it? It's me, Julian!

recruit-visit.speaker: Marth
recruit-visit.line: Julian? I'd heard that you'd gone to Macedon with Lena, but to think we'd cross paths here... How is Lena? Of course, she's with you, right?

recruit-visit.speaker: Julian
recruit-visit.line: Well, er, how should I say this... Lena suddenly up and vanished... I... I don't know what to do.

recruit-visit.speaker: Marth
recruit-visit.line: Wait, Julian, tell me what happened, in detail.

recruit-visit.speaker: Julian
recruit-visit.line: Lena's been missing since last night. The villagers speak of some sort of strange priest prowling around lately. It seems that somehow, Lena was taken by this man.

recruit-visit.speaker: Marth
recruit-visit.line: A priest...? Julian, as it turns out, Princess Maria has gone missing as well. I have a terrible feeling about this. Anyway, staying here won't solve anything. Come with us. I'm worried for Lena, too. We'll all help to look for her.

recruit-visit.speaker: Julian
recruit-visit.line: Prince Marth... Thank you. Nothing would please me more.

battle.speaker: Michalis
battle.line: Rucke, I'm impressed a spineless coward like you could throw this country into so much chaos. I'll hazard a guess that Hardin talked you into this?

battle.speaker: Michalis
battle.line: Thought I was dead? Haha... My death was but a trifle. Hand Minerva over to me, Rucke. I no longer have plans for this country. Do with it as you please. However, I won't rest until I've disposed of "him" with my own hands.

battle.speaker: Rucke
battle.line: U-uhh... but, Princess Minerva is barely breathing... Nobody could save her now...

battle.speaker: Michalis
battle.line: Do you want me to shove this spear down your throat? I said bring her to me.

battle.speaker: Rucke
battle.line: Y-yes, of course. S-somebody, bring the princess here!

battle.speaker: Michalis
battle.line: It's been a while, Minerva. That ungainly appearance doesn't suit you. Losing Maria; your subordinates abandoning you... Is this the ideal country you dreamed of?

recruit-talk.speaker: Julian
recruit-talk.line: Hey! Cut it out. Why must you always insist on pointing your sword at us? I pity Lena for having to put up with your stupidity.

recruit-talk.speaker: Matthis
recruit-talk.line: Oh, it's you, Julian. Are you still trying to worm your way into Lena's good books? No way, I won't hand my cute lil' sister to a thieving rat like you.

recruit-talk.speaker: Julian
recruit-talk.line: You can relax... Lena and I would never work out. But even if it's just a little, I wanted to help her in any way I could.

recruit-talk.speaker: Matthis
recruit-talk.line: Ooh, you finally realized where you stand. Attaboy, Julian!

recruit-talk.speaker: Julian
recruit-talk.line: Er, that's not the kind of thing I want to be hearing from you... Well, whatever. If you're worried about Lena, then come with me.

recruit-talk.speaker: Matthis
recruit-talk.line: Oh, alright, thanks. You see, they forced me to join the rebel army, but you know I hate fighting. Alright, lil' brother. Let's join forces and look for our cute lil' Lena!

recruit-battle.speaker: Matthis
recruit-battle.line: Lena... Where are you? What I would give to hear your voice just once before I die...

recruit-battle.speaker: Matthis
recruit-battle.line: Lena... F-forgive... your foolish big brother...

boss.speaker: Rucke
boss.line: D-damn it... Why is the Altean army here...? You're all going down with me. Die!

boss.speaker: Rucke
boss.line: The Altean knights... As I expected...

end.speaker: Jagen
end.line: Sire, the rebels have fled the castle, but I regret to inform you that Princess Minerva was nowhere to be found.

end.speaker: Marth
end.line: What could have happened? She was supposed to be held inside the castle...

end.speaker: Lang
end.line: Oh-hoh, I knew this task was unworthy. Excellent work, Prince Marth. We'll take care of Macedon from here. Now, let us discuss your next mission.

end.speaker: Marth
end.line: General Lang, what in the world do you want this time?

end.speaker: Lang
end.line: Well, you see... My castle was attacked and the Grustian prince and princess were kidnapped. The perpatrator fled to Macedon, it seems. Prince Marth, you are to capture him and return the children to me!

end.speaker: Marth
end.line: You're asking me to send those children to their doom!

end.speaker: Lang
end.line: You're in no position to defy me. Now, off to work you go, my prince.

end.speaker: Kris
end.line: You...! Your rudeness towards my liege has gone too far...! Shut up! Prince Marth is not your minion!

end.speaker: Lang
end.line: What did you say?! Know your place, Altean soldier! Marth, it seems that your countrymen are devoid of manners!

end.speaker: Marth
end.line: ...I apologize on his/her behalf. But it is as Kris says: General Lang, I will no longer follow your orders from here.

end.speaker: Kris
end.line: Sire...!

end.speaker: Lang
end.line: What! Do you mean to defy my orders?! I see... I see. As I suspected, it was YOUR doing. The person who kidnapped Grust's prince and princess was the mercenary, Ogma. On your orders, no less!

end.speaker: Marth
end.line: I didn't know of this. But if I had the choice, I would have done exactly as you suggested. Back at Grust, even though they were meant to be our enemies, I should have helped those children.

end.speaker: Lang
end.line: You! You clearly speak words of treason! Perhaps I should report this to the Emperor!

end.speaker: Marth
end.line: Do as you will. But you're not the only person who intends to visit the palace. I will speak to Emperor Hardin and Princess Nyna and inform them of your crimes. Forgive me, Jagen. But I cannot stand for this any longer.

end.speaker: Jagen
end.line: I understand. You have endured well until now. Lang, my liege might forgive your frequent rudeness to him, but I will not. Come, draw your sword. Even though I, Jagen, am old and senile, I will not lose to the likes of you.

end.speaker: Lang
end.line: Wh... what did you say?! Damn you... I'll remember this!! Once the Emperor gets wind of this, I'll crush your puny little Altea!

end.speaker: Marth
end.line: Jagen... you're a bag of surprises. To think you'd stand up against Lang like that.

end.speaker: Jagen
end.line: Sire, are you underestimating me in my old age? Bwahaha... I'm not about to let youngsters like Kris hog all the glory just yet. Still, I'll admit it was somewhat foolish to contest with Lang, even if he did push my lord at every turn.

end.speaker: Kris
end.line: Sire, Sir Jagen. What is our next plan of action?

end.speaker: Marth
end.line: According to Lang, Ogma is on his way to Macedon. He probably intends to visit the village where Lord Wendell resides.

end.speaker: Kris
end.line: Lord Wendell?

end.speaker: Marth
end.line: Lord Wendell is a pontifex of Khadein; he fought as our ally in the last war. I hear he's living in Macedon now. It also happens that the children that Ogma saved were raised by Lord Wendell So I'm sure it would be the perfect time to pay him a visit.

end.speaker: Kris
end.line: Yes, understood.

end.speaker: Jagen
end.line: But, I worry about Lang... I pray that nothing bad shall happen...

end.speaker: Jagen
end.line: Kris, are you aware that we've been searching for the assassins who besieged Altea a year ago...?

end.speaker: Kris
end.line: Ah! I assume, since you're mentioning it, that you've found a new lead?

end.speaker: Jagen
end.line: We're not certain, but we've received information that might lead us to them. A few days ago, I heard of a suspicious group heading towards Macedon's northern mountains.

end.speaker: Marth
end.line: The northern mountains? What could they be after up there?

end.speaker: Jagen
end.line: Rumors say they are pursuing our former allies in the War of Shadows... And I don't believe they're after a friendly chat with them either.

end.speaker: Marth
end.line: I see. Then we cannot ignore this lead, especially if lives are at stake. Jagen, Kris, we shall pursue the enemy.

end.speaker: Jagen
end.line: Agreed. Let us prepare to march, with haste.
